closed_reason: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and identified 4 subcommands: run (run epics with AI agent), resume (resume from checkpoint), checkpoints (list available checkpoints), upgrade (upgrade ticker to latest version). Root command 'ticker' is defined at line 38.
description: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and list all subcommands defined.

run.output:
I'll start by reading the main.go file to list all CLI subcommands defined.

Based on my analysis of `cmd/ticker/main.go`, I can now list all the CLI subcommands defined. Let me close the task with the findings.

Task completed. I read `cmd/ticker/main.go` and identified the following CLI subcommands defined:

1. **run** (line 53) - Run one or more epics with the AI agent. Supports single/multiple epics, TUI/headless modes, worktrees, and parallel execution.

2. **resume** (line 77) - Resume from a saved checkpoint. Takes a checkpoint ID as argument.

3. **checkpoints** (line 87) - List available checkpoints, optionally filtered by epic ID.

4. **upgrade** (line 98) - Download and install the latest version of ticker.

The root command `ticker` is defined at line 38, and subcommands are added to it in the `init()` function at lines 145-148.

title: List CLI commands
